text: [Music]
another thing that both affects us and
that I'm personally pretty passionate
about is memory safety so in the same
way that it seems crazy to us now that
you would start a major website and not
use a GPS like we know so much about the
risks of that it just seems like crazy
to do that now I think we're also gonna
come to a point where we feel like it is
crazy how people say stuff like well I'm
running a bank and I need to do some
reverse proxying so I'm gonna spin up
you know an instance of nginx or Apache
and do my reverse load balancing cuz
what you're really saying there is why
don't I just stick you know several
million lines of C code on the edge of
my network and that that'll probably be
fine you know that code is now safe we
cannot be writing we certainly should
not be running any new code and C and
C++ the the opportunity for
vulnerabilities I mean they absolutely
will have all our abilities and that we
need to get that type of code away from
our networks to start with and then
probably away from most other things too
so I would hope that in 10 or 20 years
we think it's crazy to be deploying you
know major or maybe even minor pieces of
software written in languages that are
not memory safe
